newsitem.title: UK: Govett GlobalSmall to convert to unit trust.
newsitem.headline: Govett GlobalSmall to convert to unit trust.

text.p: Govett Global Smaller Companies Investment Trust, which has recently traded at deep discounts to net asset value, said on Tuesday it would seek to convert to unit trust status.
The new unit trust will be managed by John Govett & Co, but holders will be given the option of taking cash at conversion.
Investors reacted positively to the news, with bids of 90 pence per share, as opposed to 81.5 pence at Monday's close.
"Our overweening aim is to provide good returns to shareholders, we are going to be pragmatic, rather than ideological about that," said Ian Taylor of fund manager.
Govett Global Smaller has traded as low as 18.5 percent below net asset value in recent months, as shareholders have dumped its shares.
"Over the last six months, more and more funds have taken steps to narrow their discounts," said Stephen Keeling, analyst at HSBC James Capel, "but the performance, on the face of it, looked poor."
Govett Global Smaller has outperformed similar funds, according to Taylor, but failed to keep pace with the market as a whole.
"Though the trust has outperformed its benchmark, it only rose by 1.7 percent in the last year," said Taylor, "As an asset class, smaller companies around the world have not performed terribly well."
Shareholders must vote on the plan of conversion. - James Saft, London newsroom +171 542 2734
